page.title: 01DALMENY and the ROSEBERY'S
page.content: The 13th century{Barnbougle Castle has been owned by the{Roseberys}since 1662.Before this, it was owned by the Moubrays, Knights Templar who settled there after the Crusades. { Sir Archibald Primrose}bought Barnbougle in 1662 and his son was created 1st Earl of Rosebery in 1703.The Roseberys lived in Barnbougle until the end of the 18th century when the{3rd Earl}decided to build further inland after being drenched by a wave one evening whilst at dinner in Barnbougle.The result was{Dalmeny {House. Dalmeny House was designed by{William {Wilkins}in typical Tudor Gothic style. Several plans were submitted. The construction of the house was completed in{1817. The primary uses of the estate are a family residence and farmland.
